repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The manuscript contains the ciṟuppapāyiram, potuppāyiram and eḻuttatikāram of the Naṉṉūl with the commentary by Caṅkaranamaccivāyar, styled naṉṉūluraipāṭam caṅkaranamacivāyam in the margin titles and published under the title viruttiyurai as edited by Āṟumukanāvalaravar, 1860.

msItem.title: Naṉṉūl Eḻuttatikāram with the commentary of Caṅkaranamaccivāyar (viruttiyurai)
msItem.author: Pavaṇanti, Caṅkaranamaccivāyar

incipit.p:
மலாதலையுலகினமலகிருளகல - விலகொளிபாபபி - யானவயுமவிளககும - பருதியினொருதானாகிமுதலீ - றொபபள
வாசைமுனிவிகநதுயாநத வறபுதமூறதிதனனலாதருதனமையின-

malartalai yulakiṉ malkiruḷkala - vilakoḷi parappi - yāvaiyum viḷakkum - paritiyi ṉorutā ṉāki mutalī - ṟoppaḷa
vācai muṉivikant tuyarnta vaṟputa mūṟtitaṉ ṉalartaru taṉmaiyiṉ

explicit.p:
- சிறுபானமைவருமெனவுஙகொளக - இனறுமிவவைரைநதியலுளளு மவகுதது
ரையாதனவறறையெலலாமிடாபபடாதிதுவெ - நிலனாகவகுததுரைததுககொளக = ௰௮ = ஐநதாவதுருபுபுண
ரியனமுறறும - எழுதததிகாாமுறறும

ciṟupāṉmai varumeṉavuṅ koḷka - iṉṉum ivvaintiyaluḷḷum vakuttu
raiyātaṉavaṟṟai yellām iṭarppaṭāt ituvē - nilaṉāka vakutturaittuk koḷka = 18 = aintāvaturupupuṇ
riyaṉa muṟṟum - eḻuttatikāra muṟṟum

extent.measure: There are two unnumbered leaves at the beginning and one blank numbered leaf at the end.

supportDesc.foliation: 2 initial leaves are unnumbered thereafter all leaves are numbered on the recto, middle left margin in Tamil numerals ending with 166. Arabic numerals are written below the Tamil numerals on all but the last leaf.
supportDesc.condition: The leaves are in impeccable condition.

layoutDesc.layout: Scriptio coninua throughout with section titles in the margin as well as the initial syllables of verses/cūttirams. On the second unnumbered leaf four verses are written in three columns divided by the string holes. cūttirams are numbered in the body of the text at the end of the commentary. An equals sign (=) surrounds the number.

handNote.desc: Fairly regular, neat hand, probably Ducler's scribe.

desc.p: On the recto of a slip of paper is written in ink the following title in cursive script:

m. Ducler No 30 /
intitulé Nannoule, ou grammaire, Tamoul /
2ème Partie /
Solliyal, ou Etymologie, (ouvrage anonyme) /
contenant 203 feuilles.
This is incorrect and belongs to the second part of the manuscript containing the second chapter of the Naṉṉūl, the Collatikāram, Indien 180.

additions.desc:
Centered on the recto of the first unnumbered leaf is incised and inked the following title in cursive script as is typical of manuscripts in the Ducler collection:
Grammaire / Malabare

desc.p: On the recto of the second unnumbered leaf the following blessings and title are written in the left margin:
ஹரி ஒம / நனறாக / குருவாழக / நனனூலு / ரைபாடம / சஙகாநம / சிவாயம
hari om / naṉṟāka / kuru vāḻka / naṉṉūlu / raipāṭam / caṅkaranama / civāyam

The following, well-know verses are written on the recto of the second unnumbered leaf in three columns divided by the string holes. The verses have been discussed and translated in D'Avella 2020. The second verse is the opening to the Kuṟuntokai.
eṇṇiya veṇṇiya ye / ytupa kaṇṇutaṟ pavaḷa mā / l varai payanta kavaḷa yā / ṉaiyiṉ kaḻal paṇivōrē
தாமரைபுரையுஙகாமாசெவடி/ பவளததனனமெனிததிகழொளி / குனறியெயககுமுடுககைககுனறி / னெஞசுபகவெறிநதசெஞசுடாநெடுவெற / செவலஙகொடியொனகாபப / வெமவைகலெயதினறாலுலகெ
tāmarai puraiyum kāmar cēv-aṭi / p pavaḷatt' aṉṉa mēṉit tikaḻ oḷi / kuṉṟi ēykkum uṭukkaik kuṉṟi / ṉeñcu paka veṟinta ceñ cuṭar neṭu vēṟ / cēval aṅ koṭiyōṉ kāppa / vēma vaikal eytiṉṟāl ulakē
தவளததாமரைததாதாாகொயில / வளைபபொறறுதுமருநதமிழகுறி / ததெ - / சநதனபபொதியததடவரைசசெ / நதமிழபபாமாசாரியனனுபதஙகள / சிாமெறகொளளுதுநதிகழதாற / பொருடடெ

tavaḷat tāmarait tāt' ār kōyila / vaḷaip pōṟṟutum arun tamiḻ kuṟi / ttē - /
cantaṉap potiyat taṭavarai ce/ ntamiḻp paramācariyaṉ pataṅkaḷ / cira mēṟ koḷḷutun tikaḻtaraṟ / poruṭṭē
In the left margin on the recto of the first numbered leaf is the following:
திருசசிறறம / பலம / நனனூலுரை / பாடம / சஙகாநம / சிவாயம
tirucciṟṟam / palam / naṉṉūlurai / pāṭam / caṅkaranama / civāyam
The following Chapter/section headings are given in the margin:
nāṉkā / vatu me / yyīṟṟu / ppuṇari / yal

binding.p: Wooden cover boards and string. 170 mm between stringholes.

origin.origDate: The date given in Cabaton's catalog (p. 30) is likely approximate, but as the manuscript belongs to the collection of Ducler, it must have been produced around this time.

provenance.p: One of the manuscripts Ducler had copied while working in Karaikal.

acquisition.p: Acquired by the Bibliothèque Nationale in 1833 (Ducler's collection).

encodingDesc.p: Tamil text has been given twice: once in Tamil script approximating as closely as possible the text as it appears in the manuscript. The transliterated text, however, is interpretative in that it follows how the text would be printed in a modern edition with puḷḷis long ē/ō, etc. A slash (/) has been used to indicate a line break for text outside of the main body.
